quotes: In July 2011, Kan stated that Japan needed to rely much less on nuclear energy.
He wanted to stop plans to build 14 new reactors by 2030.
After he resigned as prime minister, Kan said in 2012 that the Fukushima accident showed him that Japan must greatly reduce its use of nuclear power.
Kan announced his plan to resign on August 10, 2011.
On August 26, after important bills were passed, he expected his successor to take office soon.
In the December 2012 election for the Governor of Tokyo, Kan supported Kenji Utsunomiya.
In the 2012 general election, Kan lost his direct seat in the Tokyo 18th district.
He lost his district seat again in the 2014 general election but was re-elected through the proportional block.
Before the 2017 general election, he joined the Constitutional Democratic Party of Japan.
In 2023, Kan publicly stated that he would not run for a seat in the House of Representatives again.
His term ended in October 2024.
Naoto Kan married Nobuko Kan in 1970.
